page.title: 08THE ROMAN ROAD NEAR ANSTEY
page.content: We went to see a road that has recently been discovered, it is thought to be Roman. The road is 34 feet 6 inches wide and one foot deep. It is believed to be part of the roman road that goes from Colchester to Chester, as the Via Devanna. The road was discovered by two members of the Anstey and District Archaeological Society. The road is made of many stones. The stones are being counted and measured and drawn on to graph paper. At the sides of the road are large stones which act as kerb stones. On the north section of the excavation flint was found dating back to 300BC. A roman coin has also been found in the area. By Louise Bennett,Sally Collins and Charlotte Richards. Aged 9 -10.
